column2: It shows the current state of your local repo and what new files or modifications will be committed to Git in your next commit

column1: What is a "branch" of a git repository?
column2: Each branch represents a separate line of development of the same repository

column1: What is a "fork" of a git repository?
column2: A copy of a repository that can be created by any user

What causes a "merge conflict" between two git branches?
column2: The same lines of the same file are edited differently on each branch

column1: What is the most important value of Unix Philosophy?
column2: All programs should be designed to work together

column1: What is the purpose of the .gitignore file?
column2: Git won't track any files or directories that match the pattern of a line in this file
A unique identifier for each git object in a repository
